repnme.cdata!:
Central African Republic - Third Economic
            Management and Governance Reform Grant Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Economic
            Management and Governance Reform Grant Project for the
            Central African Republic (CAR) were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: a
            development policy operation can be an effective instrument
            for addressing key issues in restoring a functional
            government and contribute to setting the stage for deeper
            reforms. A programmatic series of DPOs may be better than
            stand-alone Development Policy Operations (DPOs), which may
            provide a timely response to exogenous shocks but could lead
            to inappropriate sequencing of the reforms over the medium
            term. Going forward the new DPO series should seek to link
            more strongly the public sector and economic governance
            reforms with measures to promote private sector development.
            A two-tranche budget support operation can be effective in
            supporting the continuation of reforms, especially in
            fragile countries. The project, a two-tranche grant
            disbursing on agreed conditions, helped maintain the focus
            on critical reforms and ensured that the Bank remain engaged
            in policy dialogue with the authorities before and after the
            elections. The second tranche helped support the
            government's efforts to restore fiscal discipline
            following election-related slippages. Its disbursement
            helped clear arrears which, in turn, permitted other donors
            including the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the
            African Development Bank to move forward with their support
            program. In a fragile post-conflict country such as the CAR,
            Technical Assistance (TA) should be available to help
            implement the reform program supported by the DPO and build
            up capacity in key areas. TA should promote synergies and
            built on them. The policy measures under the project that
            were most successfully implemented were those that benefited
            from greater cooperation among the departments and units
            concerned. To help build robust budget processes, reforms
            should be closely monitored and a close dialogue with the
            government should be maintained through frequent supervision
            missions and a strong field presence.

17073731.majtheme: Public sector governance,Environment and natural resource management,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Central African Republic - Third Economic
            Management and Governance Reform Grant Project : release of
            second tranche

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Economic Management and
            Governance Reform Grant Project (EMGRG III) aims to mitigate
            the effects of the global financial crisis in Central
            African Republic (CAR). The objectives of the grant were to
            improve transparency and efficiency in the management of
            public resources and promote private sector development
            through reforms aimed at: 1) strengthening budget execution
            and reporting as well as public procurement, and improving
            revenue administration to increase domestic revenue, with
            the view to expand public investment in priority sectors; 2)
            strengthening the regulatory framework in the forestry,
            mining and petroleum sectors so that they can continue to be
            a source of sustainable growth, employment and incomes; and
            3) improving the business environment by reducing the cost
            of doing business.

12936804.majtheme: Public sector governance,Environment and natural resource management,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Central African Republic - Third Economic
            Management and Governance Reform Grant Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Economic Management and
            Governance Reform Grant Program (EMGRG III) for Central
            African Republic (CAR) is the fourth in a series of
            development policy operations (DPOs) that began with the
            Reengagement and Institution-Building Support Program in
            2006. It builds on the preceding DPOs and continues to
            support the implementation of CAR's poverty reduction
            strategy, as set out in the Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper
            adopted by the Government in September 2007. The operation
            supports the Government's efforts to mitigate the
            economic and poverty impact of the global economic slowdown.
            The EMGRG III is designed as a two-tranche operation to give
            the authorities the time needed to implement the proposed
            tranche release conditions in the context of an evolving
            electoral process. The reform program has been developed
            jointly with the Government and in close collaboration with
            other donors active in CAR. Also the government and other
            budget support donors as a group have agreed on the EMGRG
            III tranche release conditions. The European Union and
            African Development Bank intend to provide parallel external
            financing to help mitigate the impact of the global
            financial crisis and support the implementation of the
            government's poverty reduction strategy. The operation
            is consistent with the International Monetary Fund (IMF)
            supported program under the Extended Credit Facility (ECF).
